answers.answer: Hey I'm also pregnant with twins but I'm just 11wks I really want to ask you a lot of questions to see what's normal and what's not please take my e-mail address ***@**** so we can write to each other please i will be waiting for your e-mail :)
Hey, for some reason, they are blocking you email address from showing.  Maybe try again or you can ask me in this thread or in another thread.

I am 10 weeks today with twins.  Me too keeps wondering if we are having boy/boy, girl/girl or boy/girl.  I can't wait to find out.  Everybody is says girls by their heartbeats, but I have a couple friends with boys who said their heartbeats were very high.  It's a old wives tale, so I'm open either way.  I would love one of each but will be very happy with whatever God gives us.  Hope all is well with everybody else.

I'm not having twins, but triplets.  I couldn't wait to find out what they were and started bugging my doctor about 11 weeks.  I'm 23 weeks now and he's nearly positive it's 2 boys and a girl.  I totally know how you feel about wanting one girl - the day I found out about triplets I called my mom crying saying, "What if it's 3 boys?!?"  It's so hard to restrain myself in the girls' clothing sections of stores.  I've got a baby (my girl) down by my hip bone, too, and she's the most active.  I personally think she's down there trying to get away from her brothers already. :)  Good luck to you!!

hi girls, i am 31 weeks with my girls.we had our  cagillionth level 3 ultrasound wednesday and they are doing perfectly. baby a(Kai)  is transverse below my  belly button and baby b (Rayen) is transverse above my belly button between my ribs(ooowwww) their heads are on the left and their feet are on the right.kai is up to 4 pounds 6 ounces and rayen is 3 pounds 13 ounces. you can see fingers or toes going across my tummy intermittently. rayen scoots away when daddy tries to feel her wiggle but kai will nuzzle right up to his hand. isn't it amazing that they already have such strong personalities?i, on the other hand...well i am suffering a bit more. still hanging in there, just biding my time.at 10 weeks i lost a triplet and had placenta previa. that cleared well and the next milestone was early preeclampsia.(somewhat stable so far) i did fail my one hour diabetes test and am now awaiting my three hour. i have all the aches and pains you could, but guess what...i would not trade it for the world. every time i see my girls, feel their movements or hear their heartbeats i still tear up.oh and shamada, my girls fight already! you can see it on my myspace. lol.

question: Well, I haven't posted anything in a while because we've been so busy so I just wanted to check and see how all the other preggers with twins out there are doing.  I am 18w3d today and we go next Wednesday for our big ultrasound.  I begged for it last week at my regular appt but dr wouldn't budge :)  She wanted the twins to be big enough to make sure they can see everything they want to see (not necessarily what we want to see).  I've been driving myself crazy trying to plan for all the scenarios (i.e., boy/boy, girl/girl, boy/girl).  I think I have some names pinned down but not sure dh is going to agree on them (lol!)   I'm really hoping that we get at least one girl b/c this is "it" for us!  But it seems like everyone we know is having boys around the time I'm due so I'm not sure what to think.  My MIL had 3 boys so I'm trying to brace myself for that very real possibility :)  However, it is SO hard not to get obsessed with the girl baby bedding section of the Pottery Barn Kids magazine because they have so many beautiful things!!!There's not been any real excitement so far.  Just a few aches here and there that my dr. chalked up to a UTI and Braxton Hicks.  Luckily, my nausea went away in my 14th week but the heartburn is starting to come on strong.  I've gained 15 lbs so far and already feel like a cow :)  I started feeling the babies move at 16 1/2 weeks and that has been reassuring.  One of them, though, is down low on my right side and seems to get lodged in my hip bone area.  I have to push and poke to get him/her to move sometimes because it is so uncomfortable.  The other balls up on the left side.  It's funny to see a bulge on my belly when he/she does that.  DH was freaking out the other night when it happened.Well, sorry to ramble.  I'd love to hear from the rest of you in the same boat!
title: Just checking in - how are all you other preggers with twins?
